availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Edmondson (Grant County, Kentucky, studentand soldier (11th KY Cav))

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Richard M. Edmondson and Elizabeth "Betsy" Fisher Edmondson. Attended school in Grant County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attended school in Grant County in 1860. Farmer in Grant County in 1862. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 22, 1862 to March 1863. Discharged on account of disability in March 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 313A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 830.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Cordova, p. 499B.
“Edmondson, William H.,” Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0107.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 5728.
